Class ColorInputBuilder

java.lang.Object
io.github.sosuisen.jfxbuilder.graphics.ColorInputBuilder
public class ColorInputBuilder extends Object
The ColorInputBuilder class constructs instances of the ColorInput class and offers a fluent interface for creating and configuring it.

This class includes a static create method that accepts the same arguments as the original ColorInput constructor and returns an instance of the ColorInputBuilder.

You can use method chaining to call the builder methods for configuring the ColorInput. Finally, invoke the build method to generate an instance of the ColorInput class.

Note that intermediate builder methods are not evaluated until the build method is called, meaning they are evaluated lazily.

Author:
Hidekazu Kubota <hidekazu.kubota@gmail.com>

    • build

      public ColorInput build()
      Builds and returns an instance of the ColorInput class.

      Intermediate builder methods are not evaluated until the build method is called; in other words, they are evaluated lazily.

      Returns:
      new instance of the ColorInput class

    • apply

      public ColorInputBuilder apply(Consumer<ColorInput> func)

      builder instance

    • heightPropertyApply

      public ColorInputBuilder heightPropertyApply(Consumer<DoubleProperty> op)
      Applies a function to the heightProperty of the instance being constructed. This serves as a shorthand form of the apply method.

      Example: 

      // Use apply
.apply(obj -> obj.heightProperty().bind(anotherProperty))

// Use shorthand form
.heightPropertyApply(prop -> prop.bind(anotherProperty))
      Returns:
      builder instance
